origin: Early 17th century (earlier (late Middle English) as inspection): from Latin inspect- ‘looked into, examined’, from the verb inspicere (from in- ‘in’ + specere ‘look at’), or from its frequentative, inspectare.

definitions.definition: Look at (someone or something) closely, typically to assess their condition or to discover any shortcomings.
definitions.example: they were inspecting my outside paintwork for cracks and flaws
